ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 66
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh come on man, you can have any amount of money at any level (within reason), regardless of whether or not you have been twinked.  On any given day a level 20
ygData.messageBody:
Oh come on man, you can have any amount of money at any level (within
reason), regardless of whether or not you have been twinked. On any given
day a level 20 to go to lavastorm, kill rock dervishes for a couple hours
and make 100pp easy, while gaining no experience. Money is NOT a difficult
thing to come by if that's what your going after. Heck, just kill a bunch
of wisps and grab all the lightstones and sell them to the merchants and
you'll still make a killing. Plus who knows, maybe the guy is a blacksmith
and made his money that way. It's not at all unreasonable to have thousands
of pp as a monk at level 22 to spend on things, because we don't exactly
have a very expensive profession.
----- Original Message -----
From: Seamus McNeill <smcneill@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 14, 1999 11:23 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Digest Number 66


> From: Seamus McNeill <smcneill@...>
>
> i don't be caring how *hic* much you hunted mammoths. By your 22nd yeer
> you still *burp* canna afford an exe hood, serpentine bracers and hav
> mutliple black pearls....unless yer twinked or yer *hic* guild twinked the
> mudder loving hell out a ya. Still either way....it's a friggin shame
> that peepol twink themselves or allow themselves to be *burp* twinked.
>
> Sligo
> Cazic Thule
>
> p.s. ill say this in plain ole english...not drunk speek. I saw a
> 17-19th level SK hunting in Oasis. Full suit of rubi/carnal armor.
> Purity Belt, Dark Reaver, BP Choker, Plantinum Silver Ruby Veil, Dwarven
> Work Boots and a White Wolf Hide Cloak. Whats the fun at that
> point...when everything you want for your character you already have.
> There is just no point. I wish twinking was a bannable offense.
>
>
